The Story of the Ghost who had been a Householder who had settled a Dispute
“You are garlanded, wearing a diadem and armlets,
and you have on sandalwood ointment;
your facial complexion is clear,
and you shine with the colour of the sun.
Your non-human retinue,
those who attend on you,
and the ten thousand maidens

analyzed: yā paricārikā  tā kambu kāyūra dharā
translated: who are your female attendants,🔽wearing armlets and anklets,
adorned with gold and ivory.
You are one of great influence,
with the appearance of one who makes the hairs bristle;
you yourself tear out your back flesh
and eat it raw.
What evil was done by body, speech,
or mind,
by the ripening of what deed🔽do you yourself tear out your back flesh

analyzed: sāmam ukkat ca khādasi iti  attana uham anatthāya  jīva loke acārisa
translated: and eat it raw?”🔽“In the world of the living,🔽I did harm to myself
through malicious tale-bearing, lying,
and through cheating and deceiving.
Then, having gone to an assembly,
when the time for speaking the truth had arrived,
after denying the truth and the Dhamma,
I acted contrary to the Dhamma.
Thus I eat my own flesh,
I who have back flesh;
Just as I eat today
the flesh of my own back.”
“What you have seen, Nārada, with your own eyes
Those who are compassionate and speak what is skillful

original: Mā pesuṇaṁ mā ca musā abhāṇi,
analyzed: mā pesuṇam mā ca musā abhāṇi
translated: Do not slander or speak falsely,
Do not eat your own flesh.”
The Story of the Ghost who was a Judge of Disputes is the ninth.
